assumptions.title: Classical Mechanics Framework
assumptions.text: Classical mechanics framework: relativistic effects negligible (`v < < c`), quantum effects negligible for macroscopic bodies

symbol_definitions.definition: Characteristic velocity of the system
Speed of light in vacuum
de Broglie wavelength of particles in the system
Characteristic length scale of the system

assumptions.title: Point Mass Approximation
assumptions.text: Both bodies can be treated as point masses with spherically symmetric mass distributions

assumptions.title: Inertial Reference Frame
assumptions.text: Observations are made from an inertial (non-accelerating) reference frame

assumptions.title: Conservation Laws
assumptions.text: Total energy, linear momentum and angular momentum are conserved.

symbol_definitions.definition: Total energy of the system
Total momentum vector of the system
Total angular momentum vector of the system
Time

assumptions.title: System Isolation
assumptions.text: System is sufficiently isolated from external influences (for gravitational systems: negligible external perturbations)

assumptions.title: Perfect Blackbody
assumptions.text: The spectral energy density `u(nu,T)` describes radiation from a perfect black body - an idealized emitter that absorbs all incident radiation and re-emits it purely based on temperature `T`

assumptions.title: Thermal Equilibrium
assumptions.text: The radiation field is in thermal equilibrium at temperature `T`, meaning the emission and absorption rates are balanced and the energy distribution is time-independent

assumptions.title: Electromagnetic Polarization
assumptions.text: Electromagnetic waves have two independent polarization directions (transverse to propagation direction)

assumptions.title: Light Speed Constant
assumptions.text: The speed of light in vacuum is constant and independent of the motion of the source or observer

symbol_definitions.definition: Speed of light in vacuum, exact value by definition in SI units.

assumptions.title: Constant Relative Velocity
assumptions.text: Reference frames move with constant relative velocity (no acceleration)

symbol_definitions.definition: Relative velocity between reference frames
Time

assumptions.title: Variational Calculus Framework
assumptions.text: System describable by generalized coordinates `q_i(t)` with well-defined, twice-differentiable Lagrangian `L(q_i, dot q_i, t)`, smooth trajectories, and suitable boundary conditions for variational analysis (fixed endpoints, allowable interior variations)

symbol_definitions.definition: Generalized coordinates describing the system configuration
Time derivatives of generalized coordinates (generalized velocities)
Lagrangian function of the system
Time parameter
Variation of generalized coordinates
Initial and final times (fixed endpoints)

assumptions.title: Stationary Action Principle
assumptions.text: The system obeys the principle of stationary action (least action principle), meaning the path taken by the system makes the action stationary, leading to the Euler-Lagrange equations

assumptions.title: Flat Spacetime
assumptions.text: Spacetime is flat, no gravitational effects considered

assumptions.title: Well-Defined Rest Mass
assumptions.text: Particles have well-defined rest masses that do not depend on the reference frame

assumptions.title: Hilbert Space Probability Structure
assumptions.text: Quantum measurement outcomes correspond to orthogonal projection operators (projectors) on a complex Hilbert space `H`, where projectors are self-adjoint operators satisfying `P^2 = P = P^ast`. Probabilities can be assigned to these projectors via a probability measure `mu`

symbol_definitions.definition: Complex Hilbert space of quantum states
Projector (orthogonal projection operator) on `H`, satisfying idempotence and self-adjointness
Probability measure mapping projectors to real numbers in `[0,1]`

assumptions.title: Gleason Theorem Conditions
assumptions.text: The Hilbert space has dimension at least 3 (`dim(H) >= 3`), and the probability assignment on projectors (orthogonal projection operators `P` satisfying `P^2 = P = P^ast`) is continuous

symbol_definitions.definition: Complex Hilbert space of quantum states
Dimension of the Hilbert space
